intermediate.question: Which of the following best describes the role of Active Record in a Ruby on Rails application?
options: It handles the routing of HTTP requests to controllers.
It provides an interface for connecting to and interacting with databases.
It defines the views and templates for rendering HTML.
It manages the deployment of the application to cloud services.
intermediate.hint: Active Record is primarily concerned with the database layer in Rails.

intermediate.question: In Ruby, what is the purpose of the 'initialize' method in a class?
options: To define class-level variables that are shared across all instances.
To set up the initial state of an object when it's created.
To handle errors that occur during the program execution.
To define a class method that can be called without an instance.
intermediate.hint: This method is automatically called when a new object is instantiated.

intermediate.question: What is a key characteristic of RESTful APIs created with Ruby on Rails?
